de.comroid.javacord.util.commands

Annotation Type Command


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface Command
    Marks a method as a command.

    The return value of such a command method is used as the response to the actual command. The response is deleted when the command message is deleted. Command methods can return one of the following:

    String
    EmbedBuilder
    MessageBuilder
    InformationMessage
    PagedEmbed
    PagedMessage
    RefreshableMessage
    InfoReaction
    Anything not listed here will be converted to a string using String.valueOf(Object).

    A command method can have different types of parameters, any of which will be set to their respective value:

    Class
    		 Respective value
    		 Notes
    CommandRepresentation The representation of the command that was used.
    DiscordApi The API that caught the command message's event.
    MessageCreateEvent
    		 The MessageCreateEvent that triggered the command. null if the command was triggered by a MessageEditEvent.
    MessageEditEvent
    		 The MessageEditEvent that triggered the command. null if the command was triggered by a MessageCreateEvent.
    Server The server that the command was sent in. null if the command was sent in a PrivateChannel.
    Boolean
    		 Whether the command was sent in a private chat.
    TextChannel The TextChannel that the command was sent in.
    ServerTextChannel The ServerTextChannel that the command was sent in. null if the command was sent in a PrivateChannel.
    PrivateChannel
    		 The PrivateChannel that the command was sent in. null if the command was sent in a ServerTextChannel.
    Message The command message.
    User The user that authored the command message. null if there is no User. See OptionalMessageEvent.getMessageAuthor() for more information.
    MessageAuthor The author of the command message. null if there is no MessageAuthor. See OptionalMessageEvent.getMessageAuthor() for more information.
    String[] The arguments of the command.
    Command.Parameters A parameter object that carries all command parameters.
    Any type that is not listed here will get null as a parameter.

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.String[] aliases
      Defines aliases for the command.
      boolean async
      Defines whether a command should be executed async.

      Defines the description that is shown in a help command.

      Defines whether this command should be usable in a private chat.

      Defines the maximum amount of arguments allowed for the command to run.

      Defines the minimum amount of arguments required for the command to run.

      Defines the ordinal index of the command in the group, as listed in a help command.

      Defines the minimum amount of channel mentions required for the command to run.

      Defines a permission that the user is required to have be in the executing context; e.g. the ServerTextChannel.

      Defines whether the command is shown in the default help command.

      Defines the usage that is shown in a help command.
      boolean useTypingIndicator
      Defines whether the bot should send a typing indicator in the command channel while processing the command.

    • Element Detail

      • aliases

        public abstract java.lang.String[] aliases
        Defines aliases for the command. Must not contain null.
        Returns:
        The aliases of the command.
        Default:
        {}

      • description

        public abstract java.lang.String description
        Defines the description that is shown in a help command.
        Returns:
        The description of the command.
        Default:
        "No description provided."

      • usage

        public abstract java.lang.String usage
        Defines the usage that is shown in a help command.
        Returns:
        The usage of the command.
        Default:
        "No usage provided."

      • ordinal

        public abstract int ordinal
        Defines the ordinal index of the command in the group, as listed in a help command.
        Returns:
        The ordinal of the command in the group.
        Default:
        2147483647

      • shownInHelpCommand

        public abstract boolean shownInHelpCommand
        Defines whether the command is shown in the default help command. Default value is TRUE.
        Returns:
        Whether to list this command in the default help command.
        Default:
        true

      • enablePrivateChat

        public abstract boolean enablePrivateChat
        Defines whether this command should be usable in a private chat. Default value is true.
        Returns:
        Whether this command is available in private chat.
        Default:
        true

      • enableServerChat

        public abstract boolean enableServerChat
        Defines whether this command should be usable in a server chat. Default value is true.
        Returns:
        Whether this command is available in server chat.
        Default:
        true

      • requiredDiscordPermissions

        public abstract org.javacord.api.entity.permission.PermissionType[] requiredDiscordPermissions
        Defines a permission that the user is required to have be in the executing context; e.g. the ServerTextChannel. Default value is PermissionType.SEND_MESSAGES.
        Returns:
        The required permission to execute this command.
        Default:
        org.javacord.api.entity.permission.PermissionType.SEND_MESSAGES

      • minimumArguments

        public abstract int minimumArguments
        Defines the minimum amount of arguments required for the command to run. Default value is 0.
        Returns:
        The minimum required amount of arguments.
        Default:
        0

      • maximumArguments

        public abstract int maximumArguments
        Defines the maximum amount of arguments allowed for the command to run. Default value is Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        Returns:
        The maximum allowed amount of arguments.
        Default:
        2147483647

      • requiredChannelMentions

        public abstract int requiredChannelMentions
        Defines the minimum amount of channel mentions required for the command to run. Default value is 0.
        Returns:
        The minimum required amount of channel mentions.
        Default:
        0

      • requiredUserMentions

        public abstract int requiredUserMentions
        Defines the minimum amount of user mentions required for the command to run. Default value is 0.
        Returns:
        The minimum required amount of user mentions.
        Default:
        0

      • requiredRoleMentions

        public abstract int requiredRoleMentions
        Defines the minimum amount of role mentions required for the command to run. Default value is 0.
        Returns:
        The minimum required amount of role mentions.
        Default:
        0

      • runInNSFWChannelOnly

        public abstract boolean runInNSFWChannelOnly
        Defines whether a command should only be usable in an NSFW channel.
        Returns:
        Whether to run this command in NSFW channels only.
        Default:
        false

      • convertStringResultsToEmbed

        public abstract boolean convertStringResultsToEmbed
        Defines whether all returned Strings should be converted to an embed using DefaultEmbedFactory.
        Returns:
        Whether to convert all String-type results to embeds.
        Default:
        false

      • useTypingIndicator

        public abstract boolean useTypingIndicator
        Defines whether the bot should send a typing indicator in the command channel while processing the command.

        This value should only be set to TRUE if the command evaluation is expected to take a long time.

        Note that this will not work well when not responding with a message, as a typing indicator will last until either a message is sent or for 5 seconds. This will also send a typing indicator to the channel the command has been invoked in and, if open, the private channel to the user who sent the command.

        Read more on the documentation: https://discordapp.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#trigger-typing-indicator

        Returns:
        Whether to use a typing indicator.
        Default:
        false

      • async

        public abstract boolean async
        Defines whether a command should be executed async.
        Returns:
        Whether to run the command method async.
        Default:
        false
